"Your Sister's Sister" is a beautiful film that explores themes of love, family, and self-discovery. It features stunning performances from Rosemarie DeWitt and Mark Duplass.

"Alice in Wonderland", on the other hand, is a visually stunning adaptation of Lewis Carroll's classic tale. With Johnny Depp as the Mad Hatter, it's a whimsical and fantastical ride that will transport you to another world!

Which one piques your interest?

It's a classic underdog story that shares some of the same themes and character-driven elements as Marc Lawrence's films, like determination and self-discovery. Plus, it features a memorable performance from Pat Morita, who teaches Daniel LaRusso (Ralph Macchio) the ways of karate.

If you're looking for something more recent, "The Kids Are All Right" is another great option. It's a heartwarming and humorous exploration of what makes a family, featuring standout performances from Annette Bening, Mark Ruffalo, and Julianne Moore.
